p:
It was hRV that had a detection rate of 3.41% (216/6327) in this study; hRV had a great impact on persons under 60 years old and was a major viral pathogen of ILI during the study period (Table 1). In many regions of the world, there have been reports of outbreaks caused by hRV, such as the UK (2009–2017)
8 and Vietnam (2013–2015),
5 at 2.14% and 8.8%, respectively. Our study showed that hRV infection occurred predominantly in April, July, and August, with the majority of cases in the 5–24 years age group ( Table 1). The virus was also highly associated with influenza and other pathogens. Respiratory symptoms caused by hRV are complicated, easily leading to a misdiagnosis and delayed treatment.
9 In the future, it is necessary to strengthen the monitoring of hRV in ILI patients, provide data support for the early warning and prevention of relevant epidemic situations, and avoid large-scale epidemics.
